sentences.en: Bratby's grandfather had been artistically inclined.
sentences.cn: 布拉特比的祖父很有艺术天分。

sentences.en: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.cn: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.en: He inclined forward so as to hear more clearly.
sentences.cn: 他向前倾斜着身体,以便听得更清楚些.
他很有帝王风范地点了点头。

sentences.en: He inclined towards the speaker to hear more clearly.
sentences.cn: 他把身体倾向发言人,以便听得更清楚些.

sentences.en: Henry was inclined to seek solace in drink.
If you are so inclined, you can watch TV.
sentences.cn: 如果你这么想看电视，你就看吧。

sentences.en: Jack inclined his head very slightly.
Martin is inclined to rush in where angels fear to tread.
sentences.cn: 马丁总是喜欢贸然行事。

sentences.en: Nobody felt inclined to argue with Smith.
sentences.cn: 没人愿意与史密斯争辩。

sentences.en: She has always been inclined to excitability.
She was inclined to trust him.
The leaves are inclined to scorch in hot sunshine.
sentences.cn: 叶子在酷热的阳光下容易枯黄。

sentences.en: They felt inclined to throw the whole thing over.
sentences.cn: 他们倾向于放弃整件事.

words.tran_cn: 倾斜；倾向（incline的ing形式）；点头弯腰

trans.tran_en: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

trans.tran_cn: （使）倾斜( incline的过去式和过去分词)，（使）偏向
